clinical_study.brief_title: Emotion Regulation Group Treatment for Gambling Disorder - a Pilot Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Group Cognitive Behavioral Therapy for Problem Gambling With a Focus on Emotion Regulation - A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: Group cognitive behavioral therapy for Gambling Disorder (GD) with a focus on emotion regulation - A pilot study This pilot study will evaluate the feasibility and possible effectiveness of a novel treatment protocol developed within the research group including emotion regulation techniques for the treatment of GD.

detailed_description.textblock:
The manual is based on principles from so called third wave cognitive behavioral therapy, which differs from current treatment within standard care in that focus is more on emotion regulation techniques. The treatment consists of an 8- session program delivered by weekly sessions. The study is an open trial in order to evaluate the possible benefit of components of emotion regulation in treating gambling disorder (GD). Participants with psychiatric comorbidities will be included and symptoms of comorbidities will be measured as secondary outcomes.
Once included in the study the participant will be measured weekly on symptoms of gambling disorder.
By increasing competencies in emotion regulation (such as active problem solving, acceptance and reappraisal of events in order to change their emotional impact) the hypothesis is that the participants will improve on measures of symptoms of GD as well as gambling expenditure in terms of time and money.

primary_outcome.description: Change in gambling symptoms will be measured by Gambling symptoms assessment scale (G-SAS) - a 12-item scale measuring symtoms of gambling disorder within the last week. Maximum score 48. Higher scores indicating more severe problems.
Change in time and money spent on gambling, per week

secondary_outcome.time_frame: PHQ-9 will be administered: assessment prior to treatment, weekly measures during the 8 weeks of treatment, at treatment termination and 3, 6 and 12 months after treatment termination.
secondary_outcome.description: Patient health questionnaire, PHQ-9 - measuring symtoms of depression with the last 2 weeks. Maximum score: 27. Higher scores indicating more severe problems.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: GAD- 7 will be administered: assessment prior to treatment, weekly measures during the 8 weeks of treatment, at treatment termination and 3, 6 and 12 months after treatment termination.
secondary_outcome.description: Generalized Anxiety Disorder 7 item, GAD-7.Maximum score: 21. Higher scores indicating more severe problems

secondary_outcome.time_frame: WHOQOL-Bref will be administered: assessment prior to treatment, at treatment termination and 3, 6 and 12 months after treatment termination.
secondary_outcome.description: Measures quality of life in four domains (psychological, social, environmental and physical)

other_outcome.time_frame: will be administered: assessment prior to treatment, at treatment termination and 3, 6 and 12 months after treatment termination.
other_outcome.description: Gambling Urge Scale, 6 item - measuring gambling urges. Maximun score of 18. Higher score = stronger urges.

other_outcome.time_frame: CEQ-G will be administered: assessment prior to treatment, at treatment termination and 3, 6 and 12 months after treatment termination.
other_outcome.description: Craving experiences questionnaire for gambling (CEQ-G)- measuring gambling cravings in terms of frequency and intensity within the last week. 16 item scores from 0-10. Maximum score of 160. Higher scores = more strong and/or intense cravings.

other_outcome.time_frame: AUDIT will be administered: assessment prior to treatment, at treatment termination and 3, 6 and 12 months after treatment termination.
other_outcome.description: Alcohol Use Disorder Identification Test, AUDIT

other_outcome.time_frame: DUDIT will be administered: assessment prior to treatment, at treatment termination and 3, 6 and 12 months after treatment termination.
other_outcome.description: Drug Use Disorder Identification Test, DUDIT

other_outcome.time_frame: DERS - 16 will be administered: assessment prior to treatment, at treatment termination and 3, 6 and 12 months after treatment termination.
other_outcome.description: Difficulties in Emotion Regulation Scale, DERS- 16

other_outcome.time_frame: AAQ-II will be administered: assessment prior to treatment, weekly measures during the 8 weeks of treatment, at treatment termination and 3, 6 and 12 months after treatment termination.
other_outcome.description: Acceptance and Action Questionnaire - AAQ - II - a measure of psychological flexibility and acceptance which will be analysed as mediator in treatment. 6 items, maximum score of 42. Higher scores indicating more inflexibility and experiential avoidance.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Gambling Disorder according to DSM 5
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to speak and read Swedish
- Symptoms of manic episode
- Severe psychiatric condition in need of urgent care
